title: channel.recv_exit_status() hanging
body:
We are seeing channel.recv_exit_status() hanging seemingly indefinitely in certain cases. From some minor testing, it seems related to the size of the output returned. 

Consider the script below, when NUM_LOOPS=3500, the command executes just fine, and in only about ~1 second. But If I increase it to 4000, then it just hangs indefinitely. The number it hangs on appears to vary with the size of the output (aka, I can get to at least 10k if I echo 'banana' instead). Of course, this could all be a red herring, but thought I'd include it in case relevant.

```
import logging
import socket
import time
import paramiko
import re


def _ssh_address(address, command, timeout=30):
    """
    Executes a command on a remote server over ssh.

    Sends a command over ssh to a remote machine and returns the stdout,
    stderr, and exit status. It will verify that the exit status of the
    command matches expected_return_code unless expected_return_code=None.
    """
    print "remote_command[%s]: %s" % (address, command)
    ssh = paramiko.SSHClient()
    ssh.set_missing_host_key_policy(paramiko.AutoAddPolicy())

    args = {'username': 'root'}
    print "SSH address = %s, args = %s" % (address, args)

    ssh.connect(address, **args)
    transport = ssh.get_transport()
    transport.set_keepalive(20)
    channel = transport.open_session()
    channel.settimeout(timeout)
    channel.exec_command(command)
    print "exec_command"
    exit_status = channel.recv_exit_status()  # Blocks until command succeeds
    print "recv_exit_status"
    stdout = channel.makefile('rb').read()  # Be sure to read before the channel closes
    print "stdout"
    stderr = channel.makefile_stderr('rb').read()
    print "stderr"
    channel.close()
    print "closed"
    return (exit_status, stdout, stderr)

if __name__ == '__main__':
    NUM_LOOPS=4000
    exit_status, stdout, stderr = _ssh_address('lotus-33vm15', 'for i in {1..%s}; do echo "Some random output from a command."; done' % NUM_LOOPS)
    print "Exit status %s" % exit_status
    print "stdout %s" % stdout
    print "stderr %s" % stderr
```

paramiko version is 1.7.5
